job_description: Empowering Africa‚Äôs tomorrow, together‚Ä¶one story at a time.With over 100 years of rich history and strongly positioned as a local bank with regional and international expertise, a career with our family offers the opportunity to be part of this exciting growth journey, to reset our future and shape our destiny as a proudly African group.My Career Development Portal: Wherever you are in your career, we are here for you. Design your future. Discover leading-edge guidance, tools and support to unlock your potential. You are Absa. You are possibility.Job SummaryTo provide specialist advice and support in business enablement and creation of information to inform decision making.Job DescriptionJob Purpose:Understand, report, and challenge the performance of the business via highly clear and concise management information. Support key business decisions through providing detailed analysis of the financial implications. To support the business partner community by:Providing the senior management team with an insightful knowledge of the bank‚Äôs business drivers through robust and challenging analysis.Providing a proactive approach to improving quality of management information and analysis.Acting as a focal point for communication between Finance and other departments / clusters within ABK and Group Finance, on budget and performance issues.Identifying cost drivers and recommending cost control / management initiativesTake the lead in Business banking finance support.Business liaison - completing ad hoc analysis and answering queries as requested by the business.Key AccountabilitiesPlanning‚Äì 40%To co-ordinate preparation of RBB‚Äôs medium term plan and budgets including providing management with analytical support to enable them to prepare and submit quality budgets within agreed time frames.To challenge functional budgets thereby ensuring that they are realistic and stretching.To ensure capital budgets are adhered to.Build a relationship with all budget holders at all levels.Ensure functional and Group cross-working in Country and with center teamsTo agree key budget assumptions and to prepare the budget timetable.Prepare CMC and Board packs on MTP / STP.Business Performance Management, Decision Support and Strategy / Planning - 45%Challenge plans to commit costs, identifying areas for cost efficiency and managing the delivery of benefitsSupport production of specific technical elements of Management Accounts including Regulatory Reporting, the provision of core ongoing accounting operations, chart of values, etc.Carry out ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù analysis for the business to assess the benefits of new products, investments, or strategiesCritically review output to ensure that it is a sufficient standard in terms of both presentation and accuracy. Continuously review processes and deliverables to find more efficient means of production and more effective means of presentationAnswer technical queries on the production of financialsTo provide an updated annual/half yearly forecast of performance against budget.Carry out monthly financial reporting to the regional office in South AfricaPrepare finance mancom decks to assist the business optimize on its financial performance.Financial Control- 10%Challenge plans to commit costs, identifying areas for cost efficiency and managing the delivery of benefitsSupport production of specific technical elements of Management Accounts including Regulatory Reporting, the provision of core ongoing accounting operations, chart of accounts, etcTeam and Staff Management: 5%Take responsibility for personal performance development, training and career development plans and ensure they are relevant and progressedActively contribute to both immediate team and relevant customer contacts.Preferred QualificationBachelors degree and Professional Qualifications: Financial Sciences (Required).Preferred ExperienceKnowledge of Absa accounting policies and procedures.Good understanding of business strategic objectives.Good understanding of business processes and activities and the underlying cost driverPart qualified/ newly qualified accountant (those training towards accounting qualifications will be considered)Proven experience of working in a financially focused roleFinancial ModellingBanking experience (particularly important for RBB Product Profitability role)Knowledge And SkillsAn ability to acquire skills quickly to interrogate systems e.g., TM1.Good communication skills, particularly the ability to summarize large amounts of data and present in a concise and readily understood format.Ability to communicate complex financial analysis to non-financial people.Absa Bank Kenya is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. Preference will be given to suitable candidates from designated groups whose appointments will contribute towards the achievement of equitable demographic representation of our workforce profile and add to the diversity of the Bank.Application Deadline ‚Äì 10th February 2026***EducationBa

job_description: About The RoleLocation: DIFC, DubaiDepartment: FinanceReports to: Financial ControllerWe are seeking an experienced and proactive Senior Accountant to join our Finance team within a collaborative, innovative, and tech-driven SaaS environment. This role is pivotal in ensuring the integrity of financial reporting, leading key close processes, and driving continuous improvement through ERP migration, systems automation, and process optimisation.The successful candidate will be a qualified accountant with more than 3 years‚Äô post-qualification experience, capable of operating with a high degree of autonomy while also guiding and coaching junior team members. This is a hands-on role with strong exposure to change initiatives and cross-functional collaboration.Key ResponsibilitiesFinancial Accounting & CloseTake ownership of month-end and year-end close processes, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and timely delivery.Prepare and review complex journal entries, accruals, prepayments, and adjustments.Perform and review balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and resolving discrepancies.Ensure proper maintenance and integrity of the general ledger and subsidiary ledgers.Support preparation of management reports and financial analysis as required.Compliance & ControlsEnsure compliance with applicable accounting standards, regulatory requirements, and internal controls.Maintain strong audit trails and supporting documentation.Act as a key point of contact for internal and external audits.AR / AP OversightMaintain a solid understanding of Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable processes, ensuring appropriate controls and accurate accounting.Provide oversight, review, and guidance along with processing at month end close.Support resolution of complex AR/AP issues and escalations when required.Intercompany & Group AccountingManage and review intercompany allocations, recharges, and reconciliations.Ensure intercompany balances are accurate and aligned with group policies.Support consolidation and elimination processes where applicable.Systems, ERP & AutomationPlay a key role in ERP migration and finance system implementation projects.Drive and support systems automation initiatives, improving efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.Work extensively with Xero (experience preferred) and other integrated systems.Leadership & Team DevelopmentProvide guidance, coaching, and review support to junior finance team members.Promote best practices, consistency, and continuous improvement across finance operations.Act as a role model for collaboration, accountability, and professional development.RequiredSkill & ExperienceQualified accountant (e.g. ACA, ACCA, CPA or equivalent).3+ years post-qualification experience in a financial accounting or senior accountant role.Strong technical accounting knowledge and hands-on experience with GL, reconciliations, and close processes.Experience working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.Excellent organisational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.PreferredExperience in a SaaS, technology, or subscription-based business.Hands-on involvement in ERP migration or finance systems implementation.Experience driving or supporting process automation and system improvements.Strong working knowledge of Xero or similar cloud-based accounting platforms.Exposure to group accounting and intercompany structures.Personal AttributesDemonstrates a strong growth mindset and appetite for continuous improvement.Highly organised with the ability to manage priorities and deadlines effectively.A collaborative team player who enjoys mentoring and developing others.Comfortable operating in ambiguity and adapting to changing business needs.Proactive, solutions-focused, and confident in driving change.Why Join UsJoin a high-growth SaaS company with a collaborative and innovative culture.Opportunity to influence and lead ERP, automation, and transformation initiatives.Exposure to modern finance systems and scalable processes.A supportive environment that values ownership, learning, and professional growth. job_description: AeqonTJ is an enabler for the ICT (Information and Communication Technology) and Security industry in Southeast Asia, with 4 primary business verticals. It encompasses a myriad of products, technologies and professional services.We principally focus on the delivery of high quality wired-line and wireless cable products, as well as building data centre infrastructure, and providing innovative and resilient homeland security solutions. Aeqon also operate a Neutral Host business - building high-availability advanced digital infrastructure solution to meet telco companies' wireless coverage and capacity needs.Aeqon strives to overcome challenges and evolve to build next-generation technologies.To view our comprehensive offerings, do visit our website at https://www.aeqon.com.sg/ Accounts AssistantResponsibilities: Assist to perform day to day financial transactions, including verifying, classifying, posting and will manage the AR function of group accounts, working independently to ensure compliance with internal controls, workflow processes and statutory requirements Assist in accounting system updates and implementation of finance-related process improvements to enhance internal controlEnsure invoices from customers/inter companies are recorded accurately and timely into the financial systemHandle daily accounts receivable operations including bank receipts update, updating billing files, and managing customer payments.Monitor outstanding invoices and follow up with customers to ensure timely collection.Support ad-hoc finance tasks such as customer/vendor account maintenance, credit note processing and participate in portal training sessions.Assist to perform finance payment related tasks as and when necessaryRequirements: Diploma in Accounting & Finance or equivalentBasic understanding of financial accounting Show more Show less

About UsAt M-DAQ Global, we're on a mission to create a World without Currency Borders‚Ñ¢. We are a pioneering fintech group specialising in foreign exchange (FX) & payment solutions that facilitate seamless cross-border transactions for businesses worldwide.Headquartered in Singapore, our vibrant and diverse team spans six countries and territories. We foster a dynamic environment where individuals can contribute to a comprehensive suite of solutions, from advanced FX and streamlined collections to AI-driven onboarding and enhanced risk management. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in the global financial landscape, and eager to grow within a company that's constantly innovating, M-DAQ Global offers a unique opportunity.Join us and be part of the team powering faster, smarter cross-border payment and FX solutions for Asia and the world.For more information, please visit: www.m-daq.com.Key ResponsibilitiesAssisting in the review of client files during periodic KYC reviews, including gathering and verifying key information such as ownership structure, business activities, and risk factors. Supporting the assessment of client documentation for completeness and accuracy. Conducting name screening and basic due diligence searches using internal and external tools. Liaising with internal teams to obtain missing or additional client information where required. Maintaining accurate records and ensuring timely updates to client profiles in accordance with company procedures. Assisting with ad-hoc compliance projects, data clean-up exercises, and other administrative tasks as assigned by the Group Head or Team Lead. RequirementsAt least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree At least 1 year in a client onboarding/KYC environment with periodic review experience, ideally from Start up, Banking, non-banking financial services or other regulated industries Able to link diverse information to build a full picture and spot inconsistencies Good team player and able to cope well under pressure, meet deadlines and willingness to handle any ad-hoc tasks assigned Good communications skills, hands on, independent and proactive Dynamic thinking and highly adaptable to constantly changing environment and possess a positive working attitude Why Us?Make a positive impact to the world‚Äôs economy by creating a World without Currency Borders‚Ñ¢Team Innovation Mindset, People-OrientedChallenging environment, offering great opportunities to learn and growCreative and Innovative WorkplaceWe offer competitive remuneration, including employee stock options and employee benefits Show more Show less

About The ClientEstablished in 1980 and headquartered in Kuwait, the company is one of the leading distributors and wholesalers of home linens, textiles, and soft furnishings. Serving households, hospitality, and institutional clients, it complements its distribution strength with select private-label offerings. With a growing presence across the MENA region, supported by strategic partners and warehouses, the company remains committed to delivering stylish, reliable home solutions that align with evolving market trends.About The RoleTo serve as a key financial adviser to the CEO and the Executive Committee, delivering actionable business and financial insights to support strategic decision-making. This role is responsible for leading financial planning, assessing business performance, evaluating new opportunities, and ensuring the financial stability of the group.About YouAn ideal candidate must have the following:Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field/ MBA is an advantage.CFA is required (Certified Financial Analyst)5 to 10+ years of progressive experience in finance, financial planning, or corporate financial analysis.Proven experience in Budget Management, FP&A, Financial Modeling, Business Performance Evaluation, and preparing Management Reports, with the ability to translate financial data into strategic recommendationsExperience evaluating new business opportunities, conducting feasibility studies, and supporting investment decisions.Must be residing in Kuwait with a Valid Transferable Visa 18 Show more Show less

At U.S. Bank, we‚Äôre on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions, enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed in the right ways, all more confidently and more often‚Äîthat‚Äôs what we call the courage to thrive. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at‚Äîall from Day One.As a wholly owned subsidiary of U.S. Bank, Elavon is committed to building the platforms and ecosystems that help over 1.5 million customers around the world to achieve their financial goals‚Äîno matter what they need. From transaction processing to customer service, to driving innovation and launching new products, we‚Äôre building a range of tailored payment solutions powered by the latest technology. As part of our team, you can explore what motivates and energizes your career goals: partnering with our customers, our communities, and each other.We actively uphold transparent and fair hiring practices that support individual opportunity, inclusive culture, and career mobility across all levels of our organisation.We offer meaningful opportunities for growth, a culture of inclusion, and a strong commitment to transparency and integrity in everything we do.Job DescriptionThe Financial Accounting analyst is responsible for maintaining accurate accounting records, preparing financial entries, and reconciling accounts. This position requires conducting daily reviews of monetary activities, assisting with the period-end reporting process, and working closely with both internal departments and external stakeholders to address accounting matters. The successful candidate will demonstrate excellent analytical capabilities, meticulous attention to detail, and the capacity to perform effectively in a dynamic and fast-moving setting.Responsibilities include:Perform daily balancing and reconciliation of financial transactions and record entries to the General Ledger Prepare and review accounting entries and account reconciliations. Support month-end close activities, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Collaborate with the wider finance team, and other business lines to resolve incidents and analyse financial data. Maintain and periodically update process documentation and procedures. Respond promptly and accurately to queries regarding accounting policies, procedures, and issues. Prepare and develop reports for management to support decision-making. Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation and drive enhancements from ideation to implementation. Assist in preparing financial statements and reports, as needed. Basic QualificationsBachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience 3-4 years of experience in a finance role Key SkillsThorough knowledge of accounting principles, reporting, and analysis. Ability to identify and resolve exceptions and interpret financial data accurately. Strong organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Effective verbal and written communication skills. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships across teams. Confidence in learning and embracing innovative technologies to improve processes. Experience with Workday (preferred but not essential). Location expectationsThis role requires working from a U.S. Bank location three (3) or more days per week.AccessibilityWe are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment experience. If you need adjustments at any stage of the application or hiring process, please contact your recruiter for guidance and support.Total RewardsU.S. Bank is committed to fair, equitable, and transparent compensation practices in line with local regulatory and legal requirements. Our total rewards approach is designed to attract, retain, and support top talent while ensuring equal pay for work of equal value.We offer a market-competitive compensation package that includes:Clearly defined salary ranges aligned with industry benchmarks and internal equity standards.Performance-based incentives for eligible employees (as defined by relevant plan rules), awarded through transparent, objective criteria that recognize both individual and company performance.Inclusive equitable benefits that are accessible to all employees and focused around our 3 main pillars of financial wellbeing, health & wellness).Continuous development opportunities including training, education support, and career progression pathways based on inclusive and transparent criteria.Employee recognition programs that celebrate achievements and milestones for all.We regularly review our compensation and benefits to ensure they remain competitive, inclusive, and responsive
